entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Kanya Saksharta Protsahan Yojana (For Scheduled Caste Girls)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, Scheduled Caste girls who pass the Class 10th and enroll in the Class 11th at a government or recognized institution and study regularly are given an incentive of ₹3,000/- per year.
Under this scheme, tribal girl students in Class 11th who travel more than 2 km to reach school and did not receive a bicycle in Class 9th are given a cash amount equivalent to the cost of a bicycle.

The “Assistance in Case of Accidents” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to the beneficiary in case of hospitalization and becoming disabled due to an accident.

fields.schemeName: Niji Talabon Ka Jirnoddhar Ki Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The government of Bihar launched the "Niji Talabon Ka Jirnoddhar Ki Yojana" scheme aims to enhance the water holding capacity of private ponds to boost fish productivity & production as well as provide benefits to private fish farmers through the expansion/renovation of their ponds.

The “Assistance for Funeral Expenses” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for funeral expenses to the nominees of a deceased registered member.

The “Marriage Assistance” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for marriage of self and for girl children (upto 2 children) of the registered female building workers.

Under this scheme, a Scheduled Tribe family receives 50kg of wheat or rice and cooking utensils from the Panchayat upon the birth of a child. In the event of a family member's death, the family is provided with 1 quintal of wheat or rice.

The "Digital J&K Internship Scheme" is an opportunity for the students to secure first-hand and practical work experience. It also aims at active participation in the learning process through experimentation and putting into practice the knowledge acquired in the studies.

fields.schemeName: Supply Free Laptops to Visually Impaired Students Pursuing Higher Education
fields.briefDescription: The 'Supply Free Laptops to Visually Impaired Students Pursuing Higher Education' scheme is under the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Odisha. The scheme aims to provide free laptops to visually impaired students pursuing courses.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Free Books and Stationery to SC/ST Students
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free books and stationery are provided to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe students who are pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate courses at government colleges. Eligible students receive books worth ₹1,500/- and stationery worth ₹500/- per year.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Campaign, Seminar and Sports under Disability Sector
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to extend financial support for National & International Events organized by reputed organizations or an individual person with disabilities working for welfare of Persons with Disabilities.

"Madhu Babu Pension Yojana" under the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government Of Odisha is a social welfare scheme designed to provide financial assistance to elderly citizens, widows, and disabled persons who are economically weaker.

The “Assistance for Purchase of Bi-cycle” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides one time reimbursement to each registered beneficiary of the Board for purchasing Bi-cycle.

The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to the needy girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor Muslim families in the state at the time of their marriage (In case of mass marriage).

The Scheme for Maternity Benefit was launched by the Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, under the Labour Department of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers after delivery

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana- Madhya Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was started by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh in 2006. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance for the mass marriage of girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor families in the state.

BBSA is a umbrella scheme under the SSEPD Department, Government of Odisha. The aim of the scheme is to promote inclusivity and empowerment among marginalized communities, particularly focusing on those with disabilities and other forms of social disadvantage.

The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Transgender students studying at post matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education. These scholarships are available to transgender students  for studies in India only and awarded where the applicant is studying.

fields.schemeName: Himachal Pradesh Maharishi Valmiki Sampoorn Swachata Puraskar (state Sanitation Reward Scheme)
fields.briefDescription: The Maharishi Valmiki Sampoorn Swachata Puruskar (MVSSP) is a scheme under the Swachh Bharat Mission (G), Rural Development Department, H.P Government to identify and recognize the cleanest Gram Panchayat at various levels, including block, district, division, and state.

The "Maternity Benefit Scheme" was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana. The scheme provides financial assistance to registered women workers, as well as the wives & daughters of registered workers to support them.

fields.schemeName: Government Institutions for Teaching and Training of Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to arrange for education and rehabilitation of children with disabilities by providing them free hostel, education-training, food, clothing and residential facilities.

fields.schemeName: Sweekruti: Assistance to Parents of Transgender Children
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the parents of transgender children to support them in successfully raising their children against societal intolerance, stigma, discrimination, and violence.

Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- is provided to the bereaved household in the case of the natural, unnatural, or accidental death of the primary breadwinner of a family living Below the Poverty Line (BPL).

The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to state pilgrims traveling to the Sita Temple & Ashoka Vatika in Sri Lanka and the Angkor Wat Temple in Cambodia. Under this scheme, the State Government will reimburse 50% of the expenses of the journey, up to a maximum of ₹30,000/-.
The scheme provides a monthly pension of ₹500/- to senior citizens, widows, and abandoned women listed on the basis of the survey list of Social, Economic and Caste Census 2011 in the state.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹500/- is provided to widows aged 40 to 79 years who are living Below the Poverty Line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Bihar
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is provided to persons with disabilities in the age group of 18 to 79 years who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support them financially. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

The "General Surgery Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for general surgery of the beneficiary and his family members.

The Department of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Odisha had introduced a scheme named "Khushi" which aims to provide Free sanitary napkins to all girls in Government and aided schools from class 6th to 12th.

The "Mobile Lab Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides reimbursement of expenditure incurred by the beneficiaries and their dependents for the treatment of silicosis.

The "Continuation of Pension'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that provides a monthly pension to registered construction workers who have paid subscriptions for at least three (3) years.

The scheme is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, aims to encourage spirit of charity, harmony, patriotism, sacrifice and cultural devotion among all sections of the society in the state.
Under this scheme, the Agriculture Department organizes field and crop demonstrations to showcase advanced crop production methods and the latest technologies to farmers.
The "Distribution of Certified Seeds-Oil Seeds" scheme offers subsidies to farmers for purchasing certified oil seeds, helping them improve their crop yield and quality.

The “Farmers Interest Group (FIG)” scheme supports every group of 15 farmers with grants for agricultural development. The scheme offers assistance for office equipment, training, ID cards, and district-level meetings.

This scheme aims to provide employment opportunities to men and women aged 18 to 45 from the minority community by offering vocational skill training in various fields or by providing loans through the Bihar State Minority Financial Corporation, Patna, for self-employment.
The “Distribution of Rhizobium” scheme offers a subsidy on the cost of Rhizobium, to farmers raising seed farms with Pulses crops in Tamil Nadu.
The “Micro Nutrient Spray” scheme provides a 50% subsidy or ₹70/- per hectare to eligible farmers, with a focus on ensuring benefits to SC/ST and women farmers.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jati Ewam Anusuchit Janjati Civil Sewa Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to SC & ST candidates who qualify in the preliminary examination of Civil Services Competitive Examination conducted by the BPSC, Patna, and the UPSC, New Delhi, to support their preparation for main examination/interview.

To facilitate and take the medical services to the next level, the State of Goa envisaged the present scheme to provide its people with quality medical care and treatment of diseases, hospitalization and surgery through Government and private hospitals.

This scheme is implemented in Bihar since 2011 through the Anganwadi centers under the Integrated Child Development Project. Under this scheme, adolescent girls aged 11 to 14 years who are not attending school receive a monthly take-home ration and skill development training.

The scheme is implemented by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Under this scheme, registered construction workers who have completed skill upgradation training are provided financial assistance of upto ₹15,000/- for purchasing trade-related tools.

fields.schemeName: Grant for the Repair of House (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- is provided to registered workers who have been members of the Board for at least three years for repair of house. However, workers who have already received assistance for house construction, bicycles, or tools are not eligible for this benefit.

fields.schemeName: Organizing Block Demonstration on Polythene Mulch Technology in Groundnut
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers for adopting polythene mulch technology in groundnut cultivation to improve productivity.

fields.schemeName: Organizing Block Demonstration Through Department And Also Through TNAU
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Organizing Block Demonstration Through Department And Also Through TNAU" offers grants to farmers for maize cultivation. Farmers can avail a subsidy for demonstrating cultivation practices on a 1-hectare plot.

fields.schemeName: Pipes Carrying Water From Source To Field-Pulses ISPOM
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides subsidies to farmers for installing pipes to carry water from the source to their fields, offering a 50% subsidy or up to ₹15,000/- for pipes (up to 800m), including PVC, HDPE, and others.

The scheme was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Govt. of Bihar, to improve quality of education in recognized Madarsas. Under this scheme, state government provides essential facilities & infrastructure to Madarsas recognized by the Bihar State Madarsa Board & other government Madarsas.

fields.schemeName: Pension to Widows and Destitute Women
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, widows and destitute women aged 18 years and above are eligible for a pension if they are domiciles of Haryana and have been residing in the state for at least one year at the time of application submission.

The scheme is an initiative launched by the Government of Rajasthan to provide free coaching to students from economically weaker sections (EWS) and socially backward communities for various competitive exams such as IAS, RAS, and other government job recruitment exams.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Relief in Case of Death or Disability of Registered Building Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme to Provide Relief in Case of Death or Disability of Registered Building Workers" is a Welfare Scheme by the Andhra Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers LET&F (Labour) Dept. The scheme provides financial assistance to help mitigate the financial burden on the worker's family.

fields.schemeName: Providing Artificial Limbs and Other Appliances to Disabled BOC Workers
fields.briefDescription: The Andhra Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board has launched a scheme to provide artificial limbs & other appliances to registered disabled construction workers. The scheme also covers the replacement of limbs every three years based on the workers' needs.

fields.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Incentive/Award of Prizes
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Incentive/Award of Prizes” offers incentives to One Boy and One Girl each from Adi Dravidar/ Tribal/ Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity who have secured highest mark who have achieved top marks in 10th and 12th standard examinations.

The Skill Development Training program aims to equip artisans with the skills necessary for the manufacture of footwear and leather goods. The project promotes the leather industry while enhancing the livelihoods of artisans.

fields.schemeName: Seed Multiplication Scheme of Paddy, Millets, Pulses, Oilseeds and Cotton
fields.briefDescription: The “Seed Multiplication Scheme of Paddy, Millets, Pulses, Oilseeds, and Cotton” offers subsidies to farmers to produce seeds under contract with the Department of Agriculture.

The "Scheme for the Funeral Expenses" by the Andhra Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board provides financial support to the family of a registered building and construction worker in the event of their death, whether due to natural causes or an accident.
The “Quality Paddy Seed Distribution” Scheme offers a subsidy of ₹5/- per kg on certified paddy seeds.

fields.schemeName: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
fields.briefDescription: AB PM-JAY is a health insurance scheme for low-income families in rural and urban areas. The scheme aims to provide affordable healthcare facilities to the Poor. It is the largest health assurance scheme in the world which aims at providing a health cover of ₹5,00,000/- per family per year.

The PRL Award, instituted by the late Prof. Devendra Lal, former Director of the Physical Research Laboratory (PRL), is awarded biennially to recognize outstanding Indian scientists for original work in Earth & Planetary systems, including areas like Oceanography, Atmospheric Sciences & Meteorology.

The fellowship offers candidates the opportunity to pursue research in PRL’s cutting-edge science & engineering research areas. The tenure of the fellowship is for a maximum of two years, subject to annual progress reviews. The fellowship provides a competitive stipend, research opportunities.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Tool Kits to their Trained Workers
fields.briefDescription: The A.P. Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board launched a welfare scheme "Supply of Tool Kits Karnataka" provides toolkits to construction workers who have undergone skill upgradation training in trades such as masonry, electrical, and plumbing.

fields.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Incentive/Award of Prizes-For Each Subjects
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers cash awards to students from the Adi Dravidar, Tribal communities, and Adi Dravidar converts to Christianity for excelling in academic subjects in 10th and Plus 2 examinations.

fields.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free textbooks to students from 1st to 12th standard in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools.

fields.schemeName: Afforestation Schemes Providing Incentives And Employment To Tribals In Forest
fields.briefDescription: This scheme offers grants to unemployed tribals for afforestation work, providing them with incentives and employment opportunities in forest operations.

This scheme provides subsidies on the distribution of sheep units, milch animals, and calves, as well as health coverage and artificial insemination for the animals. It is targeted at Tribal communities to improve their livelihood through animal husbandry.
“SUBHADRA” Scheme is a flagship initiative by the Government of Odisha aimed at financially empowering women, improving their socio-economic status, and promoting their safety and well-being.

fields.schemeName: Workers In Case Of His Partial Permanent Disablement-JKBOCWWB
fields.briefDescription: The "Workers In Case of Partial Permanent Disablement" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial assistance to registered BOC workers in the event of their partial permanent disablement.

fields.schemeName: Loans and Advances for Construction of a House
fields.briefDescription: The "Loans and Advances for Construction of a House" scheme by the Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board provides financial support to registered construction workers to build their own houses. Beneficiaries can avail loans based on their skill level, with amounts ranging.

fields.schemeName: Free Education Scholarship for Professional Courses (Engineering, Medical, Agriculture, Veterinary, and Law)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides full coverage of tuition fees, special fees, and examination fees for Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) students pursuing professional courses.

fields.schemeName: Free Education Scholarship for Three-Year Diploma (Polytechnic Courses)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free education scholarships for students from Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes, and Denotified Communities pursuing 3-year Diploma courses in Government and Government-Aided Polytechnics.

The Scheme provides financial support to girls students of Most Backward Classes (MBC) and Denotified Communities (DNC) studying in rural government or government-aided schools, aimed at encouraging education and reducing school dropouts.

The scheme aimed at supporting students from the Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) in Tamil Through financial assistance to students securing the top two ranks in the 12th Public examination in each district.

fields.schemeName: Rastriya Arogya Nidhi - Health Minister’s Cancer Patient Fund
fields.briefDescription: A scheme to provide financial assistance to poor patients living below poverty line and suffering from cancer, for their treatment at 27 Regional cancer centers (RCCs).

The Educational Assistance for Degree Course scheme provides financial assistance to children of registered construction workers pursuing their undergraduate degree (1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th year, if applicable). This benefit is also extended to the wife of a registered male worker.

fields.schemeName: Educational Assistance to the Children of the Registered Worker Studying in 11th and 12th Standard
fields.briefDescription: The "Educational Assistance" scheme provides financial support of ₹10,000 per year to children of registered construction workers who are studying in the 11th or 12th standard. The benefit applies to a maximum of two children per worker and extends to the wife of a registered male worker.

The "Financial Assistance for Medical" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial support for medical expenses, including injury treatment, temporary and permanent disability, and the treatment of chronic diseases.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Animal Husbandry
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides loans to farmers for the purpose of animal husbandry, allowing them to improve their income through livestock.

fields.schemeName: District Central Cooperative Banks and through its Branches: For SSI Unit Loan and Other NFS Activities
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance for SSI unit loans and other Non-Farm Sector (NFS) activities through District Central Cooperative Banks and their branches.

The "Professional Education" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial assistance to regular students pursuing Para Medical, ITI, Engineering, and other recognized diploma or professional/technical degree courses.

fields.schemeName: Large Sized Multi-Purpose Coop. Society: Medium Term Loan to Tribal Members
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers medium-term loans of up to ₹60,000/- without interest to tribal members, enabling them to fulfill various financial needs.

The scheme provides financial support to Backward, Most Backward Classes, and Denotified Communities students pursuing 3-year undergraduate courses (B.A., B.Sc., B.Com.) in Government and Government Aided Arts and Science Colleges.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Sericulture In Irrigated Area
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides loans to farmers for sericulture activities in irrigated areas, with a loan amount ranging from ₹49,000/- to ₹79,000/- per acre, and interest rates from 11% to 12.75%.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Inland Fishing
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers loans to farmers for inland fishing projects, with a loan amount of up to ₹3,30,000/- per hectare at an interest rate between 11% and 12%.

fields.schemeName: Aaloo Ke Kufri Chipsona-1 Prabhed Ke Kshetra Vistaar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to increase the production of Kufri Chipsona variety suitable for potato processing in Bihar by expanding its area and to increase the income of farmers by promoting processing.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Power Tiller
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers loans to farmers covering up to 90% of the cost of a power tiller, with an interest rate between 11% and 12.25%.

Launched on 15th August 1995, the "National Family Assistance Scheme" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides ₹20,000/- to ensure social security for bereaved families living below the poverty line in case of death of their breadwinner.

fields.schemeName: Incentive For The Devadasi Children’s Marriage to Schedule Tribe
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Incentive for the Devadasi Children’s Marriage to Schedule Tribe" by the Govt of Karnataka provides incentives for the marriage of Devadasi's ST children. Couples married on or after 01-04-2019 are given an incentive of ₹8 Lakh, i.e. ₹3 Lakh for groom and ₹5 Lakh for bride.

The scheme "National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)" is a social welfare scheme by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. Under this scheme, ₹20,000/-. is provided to the family in the event of the death of their primary breadwinner.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Assistance on Death and Permanent Disablement
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial relief to the beneficiaries in case of permanent disability due to accidents or their dependents/nominees in case of accidental or natural death.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Family Pension
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, beneficiaries, upon retirement or unfortunate demise, will have 50% of their last drawn amount transferred monthly to their families through a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) system.
The scheme aims to provide subsidized mushroom kits and training to farmers, promoting mushroom cultivation as a sustainable livelihood opportunity.
The scheme aims to promote cluster-based cultivation of selected crops, including guava, amla, lemon, bael, lemongrass, papaya, marigold, dragon fruit, and strawberry.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Pension
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides pension benefits to transport workers of the state upon reaching 60 years of age.

fields.schemeName: Employability Excellence with College Education & Learning (EXCEL)
fields.briefDescription: The EXCEL program is a skill development initiative by the Jharkhand Government targeting 10+2 pass-out or university-level students. It integrates skill training with traditional education programs in colleges to improve employability.
The scheme aims to offer subsidies for planting materials, horticultural machinery, and related resources to support tea farmers.

fields.schemeName: Block Level Institute for Rural Skill Acquisition (BIRSA)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide free, localized skill training to candidates at the block level in Jharkhand. The program is non-residential and operates in 24 districts across 80 blocks in the first phase.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Vyavsayik Pathyakram Margdarshan Evam Utpreran Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This initiative offers free coaching to the students belonging to the backward class (BC) and extremely backward class (EBC) of Bihar, helping them prepare for competitive exams like NET, GATE, JRF, Ph.D., and M.Phil.

A flagship mission implemented by MoHUA, addressing urban housing shortage. The beneficiaries include Economically Weaker Section (EWS) / Low Income Group (LIG) and Middle Income Group (MIG) categories, including slum dwellers, by ensuring a pucca house to all eligible urban households by 2022.

Launched in 1976-77, the "Post Matric College Scholarship" is a scheme by the Scheduled Caste Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme provides financial assistance to encourage Scheduled Caste students to pursue higher education.

Launched in 1966-67, the scheme "Chhatrawas" is a welfare scheme by the Scheduled Caste Welfare Department, Govt of MP. The scheme provides free residential facilities in Scheduled Caste hostels for boys and girls studying in educational institutions.

fields.schemeName: Capacity Building For Service Providers - Entrepreneurship Programme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Entrepreneurship Programme" is a Suo-Moto Sub-Scheme of the Ministry of Tourism under the Umbrella Scheme of "Capacity Building for Service Providers". In this scheme financial assistance is provided to the institutes (given below) to conduct entrepreneurship development programs.
